intro: Camptostylus ovalis, commonly known as the ovalleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and dry slopes. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in open habitats with well-drained soil. Camptostylus ovalis is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native range.
